thread.title: Browns 'proud of the fight' showed in loss to Chargers
thread.title_full: Browns 'proud of the fight' showed in loss to Chargers

title: Browns 'proud of the fight' showed in loss to Chargers
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Browns 'proud of the fight' showed in loss to Chargers The Cleveland Browns were 'proud of the fight' they showed in Sunday's loss to the San Diego Chargers. Post to Facebook Browns 'proud of the fight' showed in loss to Chargers The Cleveland Browns were 'proud of the fight' they showed in Sunday's loss to the San Diego Chargers.  //on.wkyc.com/1RqVBjd   Join the Conversation To   Browns 'proud of the fight' showed in loss to Chargers Matthew Florjancic, WKYC 12:03 p.m. EDT October 5, 2015 The Cleveland Browns were 'proud of the fight' they showed in Sunday's loss to the San Diego Chargers. The Cleveland Browns were 'proud of the fight' they showed in Sunday's loss to the San Diego Chargers. (Photo: Robert Hanashiro-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Cleveland Browns trailed the San Diego Chargers four times in Sunday's 30-27 loss at Qualcomm Stadium, but in three of those situations, they found a way to either draw even with the opposition or take a lead. 
And the Browns, who lost to the Chargers on a field goal on an untimed down after an offsides penalty on the final play of regulation, believe it is that kind of an effort that will serve as a building block as they move forward with their preparations for this week's game against the Baltimore Ravens at M&T Bank Stadium. 
"Last week was a long week just with the way that one ended, and we fought hard to kind of block out all the noise and move into this week, and so, to have this one go this way, this is not where you want to be," Browns quarterback Josh McCown said. 
"One and three is not where you want to be. None of us set out and said, 'Hey, let's shoot for 1-3.' We're all disappointed, but at the same time, as men, we have to respond and we have to come back. That's the measure of who we are individually, and it carries you outside of football. 
"It's a great tool for your life, and then, when we do that, I think it will shape us as a team and we'll start to grow our character as a team. We'll find the positives. We'll find the things to gain out of this. We'll learn from the mistakes, and the main thing is, we'll respond." 
Although the Browns found a way to fight their way back into the game against the Chargers on multiple occasions, the defense allowed San Diego to score five times on ensuing drives after Cleveland field goals and touchdowns. 
"That's the best way to sum it up, whoever gets it last is probably going to have the best chance to win the game, especially the way we went into the half," McCown said. "We had it last in the half and got points and tied it up. It did (have) a little back and forth. You look back at these games and every drive is so critical, and a couple of the ones we didn't get going on, I think we'll kick ourselves for." 
While admitting they were disappointed by the "heartbreaking" setback, the Browns' second straight loss overall and second defeat in as many road games to start the season, both McCown and cornerback Tramon Williams feel the team took a positive step against the Chargers. 
"I felt like everybody battled and fought really hard," McCown said. "When you know it's a game like that where it's going back and forth and if you can just get it last, I don't know, it just hurts when you don't have a chance to have it last because you feel like everybody's fighting. 
"You come home with a loss, and it doesn't reflect the effort that was put into that game. I'm just really proud and honored to be a part of this team, and the way we fought. I'm proud to say I'm on the Browns because we fought hard and that's all you can ask for." 
Williams added, "It was a good vibe all game. The guys were together. We stuck together, whether we were up or we were down, and that's big for me. From game one to now, it's totally different. In game one, guys weren't in it after we went down. We were in it the whole time this game, confident. We believed that we would come back and those guys are making progress, so that was a good sign." Read or Share this story: http://on.wkyc.com/1RqVBjd TOP VIDEOS
